borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
The proposal, by reason of siting and scale, would be an
     undesirable addition which would cause unacceptable overshadowing, loss of
     daylight and outlook and an overbearing impact to neighbouring dwellings.
     This would result in a harmful impact to the amenity currently enjoyed by
     neighbouring occupiers. As such, it fails to protect residential amenity
     and constitutes un-neighbourly development. The proposal thus fails to
     accord with the following policies which seek to ensure that development
     proposals protect residential amenity:Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy
     Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)Policy D6 of the London Plan (March 2021)Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development
     Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)Sections 4.2 and 5.3 of the Residential Extensions and
     Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking
     and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version,
     December 2021)
 
 
 
 
 
The
proposal, by reason of siting, mass, scale and design, would be an
undesirable addition which would not appear subordinate to the original dwelling and would have an excessive depth. As such, it fails to respect or reflect the character of the original
dwelling, the terrace row of which it forms a part, and the surrounding area,
causing harm to each of these. The proposal thus fails to accord with the
following policies which seek to ensure development proposals are well
designed and respect and reflect the existing character:Paragraph
     130 of the National Planning Policy Framework National Planning
     Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)Policy D4 of
     the London Plan (March 2021)Policies
     CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy
     (July 2010)Policies BP8
     and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide
     Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)Sections
     4.1 and 5.3 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary
     Planning Document (February 2012)Policies
     SP2 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft
     Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)
description: Construction of a single storey side/rear extension to form a kitchen and bedroom and conversion of garage into habitable room.
